bis_fnc_arrayshift.name: BIS_fnc_arrayShift
bis_fnc_arrayshift.description:
This function removes the first (leftmost) element of an array and returns it.
The array is passed by reference so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it.

>

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - **NOTE:** given array must be within an array (e.g 
```sqf
[[10, 20, 30]] call BIS_fnc_arrayShift
```
)

examples:
```sqf
_myArray = ["2", "report", "status"];
_removedElement = [_myArray] call BIS_fnc_arrayShift;	// array is within an array
_removedElement == "2";									// true
_myArray isEqualTo ["report", "status"];				// true
```

bis_fnc_priorityqueue_init.name: BIS_fnc_priorityQueue_Init
bis_fnc_priorityqueue_init.description:
/*
	Author: Zozo

	Description:
	Initialize the Priority Queue data structure.
	The Priority Queue is sorted on inserting. Bigger numbers are set on higher indexes.

	Parameters:
	_maxSize:INT - OPTIONAL, sets the Queue MAX SIZE (otherwise it is set to the constant defined in the .inc file)

	Returns:
	_handle: Handle to the Queue (essential for manipulation with the Queue)

	Syntax:
	_handle:INT = [_maxSize] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init;

	Example:
	_priorityQueue_1 = [10] call BIS_fnc_PriorityQueue_Init;
*>

bis_fnc_wpdemine.name: BIS_fnc_wpDemine
bis_fnc_wpdemine.description:
Scripted "CLEAR MINES" [Advanced Waypoint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Waypoints).
The script needs a unit with the abiility to demine (engineer or explosive specialist [trait](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getUnitTrait) **and** a toolkit).

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - a group with a mine expert

position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - the demining centre. Demining radius is defined by [waypointCompletionRadius](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/waypointCompletionRadius), and defaults to 50 if set to 0

target: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - (Optional, default [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)) unused parameter

clearUnknownMines: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) should the group demine all mines or only the one [its side knows about](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/detectedMines)

syntaxArray.Params:

target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional, default [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)) ***unused parameter***

firedRounds: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 100) number of fired rounds

type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") magazine type to be used. If empty, first found magazine will be used

bis_fnc_eventtimeline.description: Universal system for playing sequential events defined by time. >

syntaxArray.Params:
timeline: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Timeline in format [ [1.0, {code} ], [2.0, {code} ], [2.3, {code} ], [4.7, {code} ] ]

music: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Music to be played which will provide the sync time for the timeline

codeInterrupt: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default

```sqf
params ["_pointer", "_baseTime", "_evenTime"];
```


```sqf
["Timeline interrupted while playing event nr.: %1 (%2)", _pointer, _baseTime + _eventTime] call BIS_fnc_logFormat;
```
)Code to be executed if the timeline is interrupted with 

```sqf
missionNamespace setVariable ["BIS_fnc_eventTimeline_playing", false]
```


codeEnd: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)) [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of codes to be executed once the timeline is finished. The codes are [called](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) one after the other.

bis_fnc_addtopairs.name: BIS_fnc_addToPairs
bis_fnc_addtopairs.description:
Adds given value to pair array, stored under unique key.

 If value is found:
 a) both values are scalars: values are added and stored as a single scalar
 b) one or both values are array: values are added and stored as a single array
 c) anything else: an array is created and both values are stored there

>

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array to search through

key: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Key to search for

value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)) Default return value if no match was found

copyArray: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to copy the array and return it, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to modify the original array
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Resulting modified array or a copy

examples:
```sqf
[[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"pear",10] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["apple",3],["pear",12]]
```

```sqf
[[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"apple",-2] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["apple",1],["pear",2]]
```

```sqf
[[["greetings","Hello!"],["rudewords",""]],"greetings","Hi!"] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["greetings",["Hello!","Hi!"]],["rudewords",""]]
```

bis_fnc_settask.name: BIS_fnc_setTask
bis_fnc_settask.description:
Set task parameters.
Create the task when it doesn't exist. >

syntaxArray.Syntax: [taskId, target, description, (destination, state, priority, showNotification, isGlobal, type, visibleIn3D)] call **BIS_fnc_setTask**;
syntaxArray.Params:
**taskId**:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Task ID
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -  In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]

**target**: Task owner(s)
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to set task of all playable units
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - set task of a specific object
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - set tasks of all objects in the group
[Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - set tasks of all objects of the given side
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - collection of above types

**description**:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"]
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgTaskDescriptions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgTaskDescriptions) class name, if empty string is used then [CfgTaskDescriptions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgTaskDescriptions) is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID

**destination** (Optional): Task destination
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - either position in format [x,y,z], or [object,precision] as used by setSimpleTaskTarget command

**state** (Optional): Task state
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of following:
"CREATED"
"ASSIGNED"
"AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
"SUCCEEDED"
"FAILED"
"CANCELED"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to set the task as current

**priority** (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - priority. When a current task is completed, system select a next one with the larges priority >= 0

**showNotification** (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to show notification (default), false to disable it

**isGlobal** (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to set task globally (default), false to set it only locally

**type** (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used

**visibleIn3D** (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to make task always visible in 3D (default: false)

bis_fnc_respawnrounds.description:
/*

	Description:
	Disable respawn until players of only one side (including its allies) remains, then respawn everyone at once.
	When "Rounds" respawn is used by only one side, wait until all its players are dead.

	Parameter(s):
		BOOL - true to force round end
		SIDE - use any side to return side affected by round system (based on description.ext respawnTemplates settings)
		ARRAY - empty array to return if a round is still on (players of more than one involved faction are alive)
*/
>

bis_fnc_showaanarticle.name: BIS_fnc_showAANArticle

syntaxArray.Params:
arrayOfArrays: [array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array); each subarray defines part of an article, can be:

* Article title: ["title", <text:string>]

* Article author and date: ["meta", [<author:string>, <date:array Y,M,D,H,M>, <timezoneName:string>]]

* Paragraph: ["text",<text:string>]

* Bold paragraph: ["textbold",<text:string>]

* Locked paragraph: ["textlocked",[<text:string>,<prompt:string>]] - *Locked paragraph with subscriber prompt. There should be no paragraph after it.*

* Image with description: ["image", [<path:string>, <description:string>, <source:string>]] - *The image should have 2:1 ratio.*

* Link to another "fake" article displayed on left: ["box",[<path:string>, <description:string>]] - *The image should have 2:1 ratio.*

* Author's bio: ["author",[<path:string>, <description:string>]] - *The image should have 1:1 ratio.*

* Draft notification: ["draft",[<text:string>, <color:arrayRGB>]] - *Text and color are optional, default notification will be shown when they're undefined.*

display: a [display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) to make the AAN article a child of it

fade: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (default: false) true to fade from black

examples:
[ 
	[ 
		["title","My Title"], 
		["meta",["Katherine Bishop",[2035,2,24,11,38],"CET"]], 
		["textbold","This is a bold text"], 
		["image",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\orange_overview_ca.paa","Some image description"]], 
		["box",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\Faction_IDAP_overview_CA.paa","You won't believe how playing Showcase Laws of War can change your life!"]], 
		["text","Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Morbi tincidunt pretium ultricies. Etiam ac ornare est, quis posuere nisl. Mauris facilisis lectus eu turpis maximus consequat. Donec ut metus nec risus tristique mattis. Ut posuere rutrum tellus, ut molestie orci mattis id. Cras ultrices euismod diam, in venenatis nunc commodo eget. Interdum et malesuada fames ac ante ipsum primis in faucibus. Morbi congue dolor rutrum lectus euismod, ac faucibus magna molestie. Aliquam in libero sit amet eros sagittis tristique. Nam pellentesque dignissim aliquam."], 
		["textlocked",["Sed non est risus. Nulla condimentum at leo sed bibendum. Phasellus laoreet sit amet leo tincidunt consequat. Curabitur nec hendrerit purus. Nam massa nisi, mattis in aliquet consectetur, ornare eget nibh. Nunc dignissim, nibh sit amet ultrices tincidunt, mi nulla fermentum quam, non condimentum dolor eros vulputate massa.","SUBSCRIBE PLZ"]], 
		["author",["\a3\Missions_F_Orange\Data\Img\avatar_journalist_ca.paa","Katherine Bishop is a journalist"]] 
	]
] call bis_fnc_showAANArticle;

bis_fnc_ambientanimcombat.name: BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat
bis_fnc_ambientanimcombat.description:
Play set of ambient animations on given unit AND allows the unit to leave the ambient state and engage enemy or move away.
>

syntaxArray.Syntax: [unit, animationSet, equipmentLevel, condition, behaviour] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat
syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit where the animations will be played

animationSet: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "STAND") The animation set to play. Possible values are:

* "STAND"

* "STAND_IA"

* "SIT_LOW"

* "KNEEL"

* "LEAN"

* "WATCH"

* "WATCH1"

* "WATCH2"

equipmentLevel: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "RANDOM") The equipment level of the unit. Possible values are:

* "NONE"

* "LIGHT"

* "MEDIUM"

* "FULL"

* "ASIS"

* "RANDOM"

condition: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
{ false }
```
) condition that if true frees the unit from the animation loop

behaviour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "COMBAT") behaviour the unit should go to, when freed. Default "COMBAT"

bis_fnc_spawnenemy.name: BIS_fnc_spawnEnemy
bis_fnc_spawnenemy.description: Constantly spawns enemies around a player according to array of enemy classes. The units will try to hunt down the player.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [aPlayer, target, side, classes, maxEnemies, delay, code] spawn BIS_fnc_spawnEnemy
syntaxArray.Params:
aPlayer: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - player

target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - refence object (enemies will be spawned on same direction in respect to the player)

side: [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - side of the spawned enemies

classes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - list of enemy classes (units will form a group together)

maxEnemies: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 10) maximum number of enemies at once

delay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 30) time between spawn waves

bis_fnc_destroyer01handledamage.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01HandleDamage
bis_fnc_destroyer01handledamage.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a damage visual FX simulation function designed to animate ships bridge windows when shot.
	  Due to engine limitation (damage simulation is disabled for indestructible objects e.g. ships components) this workaround is applied.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the ship's model part with windows.

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			HitPart = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01HandleDamage;";
		};

	Requirements:
	- Compatible object (e.g. ship component) must have a set of selections that are setup and named by convention.
	  Selections must be defined as hidden selections in order for setObjectTexture to work.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: event Handler Array as documented here - https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HitPart


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Destroyer (ship) window textures are swapped for damaged ones. Simple swap.

*/>

bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.name: BIS_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject
bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.description:
/*
	Generates simple object config data.

	Parameters:
		0: OBJECT or ARRAY - ground position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		1: SCALAR or BOOL - autolog mode (default: false)
			0 or false - no autolog, results will be only stored in clipboard
			1 or true - autolog on, results will be stored in \A3\macros_CfgVehicles_simpleObject_auto_A3.hpp file.
			2 - autlog on + world name, random number and custom suffix are appended to name of generated file to prevent overwriting and provide extra info
		2: ARRAY - classes you want to scan, use [] to scan all (default: []).
		3: OBJECT or ARRAY - sea position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		4: STRING - custom suffix added to filename if autolog is used (default: "").


	Example:
	bis_scriptHandle = [] spawn bis_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject;

	Expected output per class (animate and hide arrays can have varying amount of elements):
	#define CFGVEHICLES_SIMPLEOBJECT_class_F\
		class SimpleObject\
		{\
			animate[] =\
			{\
				{"animationName1", 1},\
				{"animationName2", 2}\
			};\
			hide[] =\
			{\
				"animationSelection1",\
				"animationSelection2"\
			};\
			verticalOffsetAsl = 0;\
		};
*/>

bis_fnc_dynamicgroups.name: BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups
bis_fnc_dynamicgroups.description: Function that adds dynamic groups to the mission as seen in End Game. Function needs to be initialized on server and client. Clients can then use action TeamSwitch ("U" by default) to access the Dynamic Groups interface.

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Mode, can be:

* "Initialize" - Initializes dynamic groups on the server

* "Terminate" - Terminates dynamic groups on the server

* "InitializePlayer" - Does client side initialization

* "TerminatePlayer" - Does client side termination

* "IsInitialized" - Checks whether dynamic groups was initialized

* "RegisterGroup" - Registers a group

* "UnregisterGroup" - Unregisters a group

* "IsGroupRegistered" - Whether a group was already registered or not

* "SetName" - Sets the name of the group, in future, will also update GroupId of the group

* "SetPrivateState" - Set the private state of a group

* "SwitchLeader" - Switches the leader of given group to the given player

* "AddGroupMember" - Add a group member to group

* "RemoveGroupMember" - Switches a player from one group to another

* "KickPlayer" - Kicks a player from group, player wont be able to join the group unless invited or is unkicked using UnKickPlayer

* "UnKickPlayer" - Unkicks a player from a group

* "WasPlayerKickedFrom" - Whether given player was kicked from given group

* "GetAllGroups" - Returns all registered and valid groups

params: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Parameter changes according to mode. Check the function in the Functions Viewer for detailed information

examples:
```sqf
["Initialize"] call BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups;//Exec on Server
```

```sqf
["InitializePlayer", [player]] call BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups;//Exec on client
```

/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Returns draw data for given TXScan

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - scan name

	Returns:
		ARRAY in format [iconData, polygonData, triangleData, rectangleData, isDefaultPolygon] where:
			iconData: ARRAY - position in format [x,y,0]
			polygonData: ARRAY - array of polygon vertices, where each vertex is in format [x,y,0]
			triangleData: ARRAY - array of triangle vrtices, where each vertex is in format [x,y,0] 
			rectangleData: ARRAY - bounding rectangle in format [center, a, b, angle]
			isDefaultPolygon: BOOL - if a scan polygon has not yet been calculated, this will be true
		
	Example:
		"myScan" call BIN_fnc_getTXScanDrawData
*/
> 
 >

bis_fnc_camfollow.name: BIS_fnc_camFollow
bis_fnc_camfollow.description: Refresh a camera Field of View according to its distance with the target.

syntaxArray.Params:
camera: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

refreshTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) transition time in seconds. If *refreshTime* is **positive**, a refresh happens only once. if *refreshTime* is **negative**, the refresh will loop (with a transition time of [absolute](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/abs) *refreshTime*) until camera [is null](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNull)

bis_fnc_setpitchbank.name: BIS_fnc_setPitchBank
bis_fnc_setpitchbank.description:
Rotate an object, giving it the specified pitch and bank, in degrees.
**Pitch** is 0 when the object is level; 90 when pointing straight up; and -90 when pointing straight down.
**Bank** is 0 when level; 90 when the object is rolled to the right, -90 when rolled to the left, and 180 when rolled upside down.
Note that the object's **yaw** can be set with the [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) command, which should be issued before using this function, if required.
The pitch/bank can be leveled out (set to 0) by using the [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

pitch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

Number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

bin_fnc_createtxscan.name: BIN_fnc_createTXScan
bin_fnc_createtxscan.description:
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Creates a scan with the name defined as class in CfgTXScans or from given params. 
		If name doesn't exists in config and params are not provided, default scan is created which could be tweaked later

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - "" create every scan from config
		or
		0: STRING - scan name
		1: ARRAY (Optional) - TX position
		2: NUMBER (Optional) - scan angle
		3: NUMBER (Optional) - scan precision
		4: ARRAY (Optional) - scan polygon

	Returns:
		BOOL - false on error
		
	Examples:
		"MyScan" call BIN_fnc_createTXScan
		"" call BIN_fnc_createTXScan - creates every scan from config
		["MyScan", [1,2,3], 20, 0.1] call BIN_fnc_createTXScan - creates every scan from config
*/
> 
 >

bis_fnc_modulecovermap.name: BIS_fnc_moduleCoverMap
bis_fnc_modulecovermap.description:
Covers the map except a defined area to highlight the area of operation. Works on dedicated server. This function was designed to be used by the [Modules framework](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Modules), but it can also be used without the module. The effect does not move with the centerObject.It is essential for the function to work that **centerObject** has the variable **objectArea** defined.

```sqf
centerObject setVariable ["objectArea",[sizeX,sizeY,rotation]]
```


* centerObject [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object which is used as center

* sizeX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  Length in x in meters

* sizeY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Length in y in meters

* roation: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Rotation of the rectangle in degree
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_moduleCoverMap.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
centerUnit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object which is used as center

units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - **Not used inside the function**

init: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to create cover map effect, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to remove all markers and destroy the effect

bis_fnc_reviveonstatejip.name: BIS_fnc_reviveOnStateJIP
bis_fnc_reviveonstatejip.description:
/*
	Author: Jiri Wainar

	Description:
	Used to execute state specific code localy on client that is JIPping.

	Parameters:
		_this select 0: STRING - Variable that carries the state value over the network, defined by macro VAR_TRANSFER_STATE.
		_this select 1: SCALAR - State.
		_this select 2: OBJECT - Unit to set the status for.


	Returns:
	True if successful, false if not.

	States:
		#define STATE_RESPAWNED			0
		#define STATE_REVIVED			1
		#define STATE_INCAPACITATED		2
		#define STATE_DEAD				3

bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.name: BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber
bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.description:
Converts a set of placed objects to an object array (**as a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)**) for the [DynO mapper](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectsMapper).
Format is the following. First, the header:

```sqf
/*
Grab data:
Mission: TheMissionName
World: Stratis
Anchor position: [3781.59, 3289.67]
Area size: 50
Using orientation of objects: yes/no
*/
```


Then, data:

```sqf
[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[0.605018,-0.575293],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[0.812812,0.190543],"","",true,false]
]
```


or, if object orientation is not used:

```sqf
[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[],"","",true,false]
]
```

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [0,0]) 2D or 3D position, center of the "grabbing" area

size: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) size (radius) of the "grabbing" area

objectOrientation: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) capture object orientation or not. Format [BIS_fnc_getPitchBank](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_getPitchBank)

examples:

```

```

bis_fnc_objectsmapper.name: BIS_fnc_objectsMapper
bis_fnc_objectsmapper.description:
Takes an array of data about a dynamic object template and creates the objects.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: position of the template - Array [X, Y, Z]
	_this select 1: azimuth of the template in degrees - Number 
	_this select 2: objects for the template - Array / composition class - String / tag list - Array
	_this select 3: (optional) randomizer value (how much chance each object has of being created. 0.0 is 100% chance) - Number

	Returns:
	Created objects (Array)

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [0,0])

azimuth: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) the template orientation

objectsArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - created with [BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber)

badChance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) must be in range 0..1. Chances of object non-creation for each object

bis_fnc_typetext2.description:
Types a structured text on the screen, letter by letter, cursor blinking. Note that line returns are manual, unlike [BIS_fnc_typeText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_typeText).
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_typeText2.gif)

syntaxArray.Syntax: [stringLines, posX, posY, alignBottom, rootFormat, abortParams, abortCond, playSounds] call BIS_fnc_typeText2
syntaxArray.Params:
stringLines: * [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - array containing lines of text with same structured text formatting. * [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) [text, format, color] * text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") * format: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "align = 'center' size = '0.7'") a linebreak is defined as "
" **and this only!** * color: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "#ffffff") posX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) posY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) alignBottom: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) rootFormat: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "%1") abortParams: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) abortCond: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default ```sqf { false ``` }) playSounds: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true))

examples:
```sqf [ [ ["CAMP ROGAIN, ", "align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '0.7' font='PuristaBold'"], ["RESUPPLY POINT", "align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '0.7'", "#aaaaaa"], ["","
"], // line break ["10 MINUTES LATER...","align = 'center' shadow = '1' size = '1.0'"] ] ] spawn BIS_fnc_typeText2; ``` ```sqf [ ["Hello there"], safeZoneX, safeZoneH / 2, true, "%1", [], { false }, true ] spawn BIS_fnc_typeText2; ```

bis_fnc_prepareao.name: BIS_fnc_prepareAO
bis_fnc_prepareao.description:
Spawns random patrols and/or vehicles in trigger areas with proper names. Side selected in the triggers "Activation" listbox will determine the side of the spawned asset(s).

Trigger **names** (a.k.a "Trigger text", **not** "Variable Name") defines the kind of spawn. Supported trigger names are:

* **GEN_infantry**: spawns random infantry patrol with sentry waypoints (**NOTE:** only circular triggers are supported, min. axis should be 500m)

* **GEN_patrolVeh**: spawns a random vehicle. If a civilian unit is synchronized with the trigger, its waypoint will be used by the spawned vehicleYou can specify the vehicle type by typing one of the following into the trigger's "On Act." field:

* car

* apc

* tank

* **GEN_ammo**: spawns a random number of ammoboxes. You can get and idea of the shape this composition will have by making this trigger rectangular with dimensions 5m x 1m. You can also specify the amount of crates spawned by using min. and max. Timeout values (supported range is 1 to 6 crates).

* **GEN_civilCar**: spawns a random empty civil car

syntaxArray.Params: density: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) enemy presence density index used for random footpatrols

	Returns:
	Integer - The index of the given key in given curve
*/>

bis_fnc_initdisplay.name: BIS_fnc_initDisplay
bis_fnc_initdisplay.description: This function is a central part of how BI handles UIs. For a full explanation see [this page](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/GUI_Tutorial#BIS_fnc_initDisplay).

syntaxArray.Params:
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* [ ] - Init displays during preStart

* [mode, params, displayClass, scriptPath, register]

* mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -  Mode, can be "onLoad" or "onUnload"

* params: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Paramameters passed from [onLoad](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onLoad) or [onUnload](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onUnload) UI event handler

* displayClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) class, usually to format "RscDisplayXXX"

* scriptPath: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Script path from CfgScriptPaths

* register: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Bool](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Bool) - Save variables associated with the display to the uiNamespace. Usually this is false when the function is called from a control.

bis_fnc_initinspectable.name: BIS_fnc_initInspectable
bis_fnc_initinspectable.description: Initialize inspectable object: add "Inspect" action to the object. When a player activates it, full-screen detail of the objects is shown.

syntaxArray.Params:
inspectable: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object on which the action is added

textureInfos: can be one of the following:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - texture path

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [texture, index, aspectRatio]:

* texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - texture path

* index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) index on which the texture will be mapped on the object using setObjectTexture. Use -1 to ignore.

* aspectRatio: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) texture aspect ratio. 0.5 means width will be 0.5 of the height. -1 means texture default.

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to instantly show the *inspectable* full-screen preview (**following params are then ignored**)

fullScreenText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be shown after clicking on READ button. Ideally localized.

soundName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound played when entering full-screen preview. Sould be defined in [CfgSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds).

examples:
```sqf
[myLeaflet, "#(argb,8,8,3)color(1,0,1,1)", "This is some Magic Pink"] call BIS_fnc_initInspectable; // Initialize
```

```sqf
[myLeaflet, true] call BIS_fnc_initLeaflet; // Show preview instantly
```

bis_fnc_encodeflags4.name: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags4
bis_fnc_encodeflags4.description:
/*
	Encodes array of unique 4-state flags (0,1,2,3) into a single number.

	Syntax:
	-------
	_encodedFlags:scalar = _flags:array call bis_fnc_encodeFlags4;

	Example:
	--------
	225 = [1,0,2,3] call bis_fnc_encodeFlags4;

	Explanation:
	------------
	[1,0,2,3] -> 11 10 00 01 -> 225
	[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1] -> 01 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 -> 0100 0000 0000 0000 -> 16384
*/>

0: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Text
1: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed when button is pressed

buttonCancel: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Same as buttonOK

icon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Path to an icon which will be shown on the left side of the message

parentDisplay: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - (Optional, default [findDisplay](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 313 (Display Eden)) Display from which the window is opened from

bis_fnc_mpexec.name: BIS_fnc_MPexec
bis_fnc_mpexec.description:
Execute received remote execution. This function is used by [BIS_fnc_MP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_MP) ([TKOH version](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_MP_(Take_On_Helicopters))) and should not be called directly.
> 
>

syntaxArray.Params:
packetName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - packet variable name - always "BIS_fnc_MP_packet" (not used in the function)

packetValue: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [params, functionName, target, isSpawn, isPersistent]. Packet sent by [BIS_fnc_MP](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_MP) ([TKOH](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_MP_(Take_On_Helicopters))) function; see their description for more details
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true if function was executed successfully

bis_fnc_kbtelllocal.name: BIS_fnc_kbTellLocal
bis_fnc_kbtelllocal.description:
Play given sentence, disable radio and/or lower sounds. Will use [BIS_fnc_showSubtitle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_showSubtitle) for better effects if channel is DIRECT or VEHICLE.
>

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be either "sentence", "conversationStart" or "conversationEnd"

parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - depends on the mode:


* "sentence": same parameters as [kbTell](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/kbTell) (receiver, topicName etc.)


* "conversationStart": [volumeCoef, disableRadio]

* volumeCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a volume multiplier to reduce other sounds but the chat (0.1 = environment volume set to 10%)

* disableRadio: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - should the radio chat be disabled


* "conversationEnd": [volumeCoefUsedInStart, disableRadioUsedInStart]

* volumeCoefUsedInStart: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a volume multiplier, shouldn't be used - if < 0 or >= 1, the volume won't be restored

* disableRadioUsedInStart: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - has the radio chat been disabled and should be restored

bis_fnc_getrespawninventories.name: BIS_fnc_getRespawnInventories
bis_fnc_getrespawninventories.description: Return respawn inventories available for the given target.

syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

showDisabled: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to show even inventories disabled by curator

returnAllInfo: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to return namespace, inventory and role limits (used in the new respawn screen), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to return only inventories

bin_fnc_setidwmapparams.name: BIN_fnc_setIDWMapParams
bin_fnc_setidwmapparams.description:
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Resets extension data, sets IDWMap params from argument, from config or default
		*** This function must be called before any data is added to the IDWMap ***

	Parameter(s):
		0: ARRAY - (Optional) areaParams in format:
			0: NUMBER - minMapX
			1: NUMBER - minMapY
			2: NUMBER - maxMapX
			3: NUMBER - maxMapY
			Default: [0, 0, worldSize, worldSize]
		1: NUMBER (Optional) - idwCellSize. Default: 20
		2: NUMBER (Optional) - idwSpreadRadius. Default: 200
		3: NUMBER (Optional) - idwSpreadPower. Default: 2.0
		4: NUMBER (Optional) - curvePointsInterval. Default: 20
		5: NUMBER (Optional) - curvePointSpreadRadius. Default: idwSpreadRadius

	Returns:
		BOOL - true on success
		
	Example:
		call BIN_fnc_setIDWMapParams
*/
> 
>

bis_fnc_calculatedatetime.name: BIS_fnc_calculateDateTime
bis_fnc_calculatedatetime.description: Returns the end datetime if an offset is passed, or the offset between start and end dates.

syntaxArray.Params:
startDate: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date) format - (Optional, default [date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/date))

endDateOrOffset: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date) format or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/date)) either the end date of the period to calculate, or time in seconds from *startDate*

timeUnit: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "s") one of:

* "s" - seconds

* "m" - minutes

* "h" - hours

* "d" - days
syntaxArray.Return: [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date) if *endDateOrOffset* is a [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) is *endDateOrOffset* is a [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date)

examples:
```sqf
[date, 3600] call BIS_fnc_calculateDateTime; // returns date in 3600 seconds (60min, 1h)
Example: [date, 60, "m"] call BIS_fnc_calculateDateTime; // returns date in 60 minutes (1h)
Example: [[2035,8,28,11,55], [2035,8,29,11,55], "h"] call BIS_fnc_calculateDateTime; // returns 24
```

syntaxArray.Params:
player: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Player unit

respawnDelay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 3) Respawn delay

revive: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) If unit was revived

bin_fnc_addidwmapmeasurementpoint.description:
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Adds measurement point to IDWMap

	Parameter(s):
		ARRAY (Optional) - position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] in which case z is ignored. Default: position player

	Returns:
		NUMBER 
			0 ... 1 - strength at given coordinates

			-999 - error
		
	Example:
		call BIN_fnc_addIDWMapMeasurementPoint

 >

bin_fnc_getobjectboundingbarrel.name: BIN_fnc_getObjectBoundingBarrel
bin_fnc_getobjectboundingbarrel.description:
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Returns bounding barrel of the given object

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - object to measure

	Returns:
		ARRAY in format [radius, height, offset]. Offset is negative if object Z position is higher than the lower bound
		
	Example:
		myObj call BIN_fnc_getObjectBoundingBarrel
*/
> 
 >

syntaxArray.Params:
logic: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the logic. Possible [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) parameter:

* "value": [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) wanted damage, in range 0..1

* "bodypart": [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "0") [setHitPointDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHitPointDamage) hitpoint name

vehicles: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - list of vehicles

isActivated: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) if [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), the fuel is set

bis_fnc_interpolateweather.name: BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather
bis_fnc_interpolateweather.description:
/*

	Description:
	Interpolate weather (overcast and fog) according to 2 boundry dates and their weather conditions.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: array	- _date1 	[_year1,_month1,_day1,_hour1,_min1]
	_this select 1: array	- _weather1	[_overcast1,_fog1]
	_this select 2: array	- _date2 	[_year2,_month2,_day2,_hour2,_min2]
	_this select 3: array	- _weather2	[_overcast2,_fog2]
	_this select 4: array	- _subjectDate 	[_year,_month,_day,_hour,_min] (default: current date)

	Returns:
	[_interpolatedOvercast,_interpolatedFog]

	Example:
	[_overcast,_fog] = [[2035,1,5,24,00],[0.1,0.5],[2035,1,10,24,00],[0.3,0.2],[2035,1,7,24,00]] call BIS_fnc_interpolateWeather;
*/
>

bis_fnc_tracebullets.name: BIS_fnc_traceBullets
bis_fnc_tracebullets.description:
Visualise unit's bullet trajectories. Can only be used on one shooter in a single instance.
If you want to change the unit, first set 
```sqf
BIS_tracedShooter = nil
```
 *then* execute the script again.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 20) maximum displayed trajectories

examples:
```sqf
[player] spawn BIS_fnc_traceBullets;
```

```sqf
[player, 50] spawn BIS_fnc_traceBullets;
```

```sqf
[player, 0] spawn BIS_fnc_traceBullets; // remove bullet tracing
```

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Mode, can be 

* "Initialize"

* "Terminate"
**There are more options available. See the ingame functions viewer for what they do. Following parameters are for "Initialize"**

specatator: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Player

whitelistedSides: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) - Sides player can spectate

allowAi: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether AI can be viewed by the spectator

allowFreeCamera: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether Free camera mode is available

allow3PPCamera: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether 3th Person Perspective camera mode is available

showFocusInfo: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether to show Focus Info stats widget

showCameraButtons: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether or not to show camera buttons widget

showControlsHelper: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether to show controls helper widget

showHeader: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether to show header widget

showLists: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) - Whether to show entities / locations lists
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Return value depends on mode. For Initialize and terminate it returns boolean depending on whether or not execution was successful

bis_fnc_codeperformance.name: BIS_fnc_codePerformance
bis_fnc_codeperformance.description:
Measures how much time it takes to execute given expression. Results may vary based on overall performance; use this function to compare alternative scripting approaches rather than to measure specific values. Upon function execution, window with results is opened. The user then has a choice to copy the result into clipboard or not. 
This function is using [diag_codePerformance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_codePerformance) command.


Keep in mind that this takes string, and that you can't pass 
```sqf
str _code
```
 as string because that add's curly braces to the string.

syntaxArray.Params:
expression: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Tested expression

arguments (Optional): [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Arguments to pass into the code.  Default: []

cycles (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of wanted cycles. Default: 10000

display (Optional): [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - Display in which the message window with results will be opened. Use [displayNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayNull) to disable the window. Default: Current mission display
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Average execution time of the expression

position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) *target*) position to place the target with calculated height

mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be:

* "ROADWAY": uses [setPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPos)

* "ASL": uses [setPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosASL)

* "ATL": uses [setPosATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosATL)

height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) height to set

mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be:

* "ROADWAY": uses [setPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPos)

* "ASL": uses [setPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosASL)

* "ATL": uses [setPosATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosATL)

curator: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Curator

mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) Mode index

array2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

examples:
```sqf

[_array, [3,4,5]] call BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack; // _array is [0,1,2,3,4,5]

bin_fnc_findpath.name: BIN_fnc_findPath
bin_fnc_findpath.description:
/*

	Description:
	A* search algorithm.
	Uses hard-coded Manhattan distance to measure distance.

	Parameter(s):
		0: ARRAY of ARRAYs in format:
			0: NUMBER - node cost
			1: ARRAY - array of neighbor indexes
			2: ARRAY - XYZ position of the node, used to measure distance from end pos
		1: NUMBER - index of starting point
		2: NUMBER - index of ending point

	Returns:
	ARRAY of NUMBERs - indexes of nodes which are traversed on the way to the ending point
*/
> 
 >

bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.name: BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.description:
Add a respawn inventory for [respawn menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Respawn#MenuInventory).
Available loadouts are defined in [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory).

syntaxArray.Params:
target: Receiver of the respawn loadout

* [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - use [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) to add the loadout to everyone

* [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)

* [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

inventoryParams: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory) class

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [class, number, limit]

* class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory) class

* number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of players who can use this inventory (-1 = no limit, default)

* limit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Limit for role assigned to given loadout (-1 = no limit, default)

* Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit.

* If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used.

vector1: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

vector2: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

bin_fnc_beziereditor.name: BIN_fnc_bezierEditor
bin_fnc_beziereditor.description:
#define POINT_W			(0.03)
#define POINT_H			(POINT_W / 0.75)
#define RESOLUTION		50
#define MAX_POINTS		16
#define GRIDS			10
#define REFRESH			([_ctrlParent] call (_ctrlArea getvariable "fnc_draw"))
#define POINTS			(_ctrlArea getvariable "points")
#define LINES			(_ctrlArea getvariable "lines")
#define CURVE			(_ctrlArea getvariable "curve")
#define BUTTONS			(_ctrlArea getvariable "buttons")
#define HOVER			(_ctrlArea getvariable "hover")
#define SELECTED		(_ctrlArea getvariable "selected")
#define SET_HOVER(CTRL)		_ctrlArea setvariable ["hover",CTRL]; CTRL ctrlsettextcolor COLOR_SELECTED
#define SET_SELECTED(CTRL)	_ctrlArea setvariable ["selected",CTRL]
#define COLOR_BACKGROUND	[0.4,0.4,0.4,1]
#define COLOR			[0,0,0,1]
#define COLOR_SELECTED		[1,1,1,1]
#define COLOR_CURVE		[1,0,0,1]
#define COLOR_LINE		[0,0,0,0.2]
#define COLOR_TIMELINE		[1,1,1,1]
#define COLOR_GRID		[1,1,1,0.3]
#define POINT_POS		[\
					(_posX - POINT_W / 2) max 0 min ((ctrlposition _ctrlArea select 2) - POINT_W),\
					(_posY - POINT_H / 2) max 0 min ((ctrlposition _ctrlArea select 3) - POINT_H),\
					POINT_W,\
					POINT_H\
				]

> 
 >

bis_fnc_destroyer01edendelete.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01EdenDelete
bis_fnc_destroyer01edendelete.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to delete dynamic ships (multi-part structure) in EDEN editor. Ship consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together based on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will delete ship parts in EDEN editor after main object is deleted.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the main ship base model (blank model with memory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble ship in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenDelete";		//function  to delete all ship objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirements:
	- An array of ship parts/objects as a variable attached to main ship base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Destroyer01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects name-space ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Ship's parts are deleted in EDEN editor.

*/>

bis_fnc_carrier01animatedeflectors.name: BIS_fnc_carrier01AnimateDeflectors
bis_fnc_carrier01animatedeflectors.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan & Jiri Wainar

	Description:
	- On demand function to invoke set of animations associated with carrier catapult jet blast deflector.

	Exucution:
	- Call the function via code/script

		[_carrierPart, _animations, 10] spawn BIS_fnc_Carrier01AnimateDeflectors;

	Requirments:
	- Compatible carrier part must have a config definition for all sub-systems that will be invoked by this function

		example of cfgVehicles subclass definitions for carrier part;
		class Catapults
		{
			class Catapult1
			{
				memoryPoint = "pos_catapult_01";											Memory point in carrier part model.p3d
				dirOffset = -5.5;													Offset angle in degrees between carrier part direction and actual catapult launch direction
				animations[] = {"Deflector_1","Deflector_1_hydraulic_1", "Deflector_1_hydraulic_2","Deflector_1_hydraulic_3"};		Array with animation names for carrier part jet blast deflectors
				launchActionName = "$STR_A3_action_launchFromCatapult_1";								Visual display name of "Attach Action"
				detachActionName = "$STR_A3_action_detachFromCatapult_1";								Visual display name of "Dettach Action"
			};
		};

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier part/object to animate
		1: animations/array of animations to animate
		2: animationState/int for required animation state


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft carrier part's specified catapult's animations are played/animated

*/
>

onSelect: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default {}) executed upon selecting a class. **Must return [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)**, which will be shown as structured text instead of params.

bis_fnc_respawntickets.name: BIS_fnc_respawnTickets
bis_fnc_respawntickets.description:
Manage respawn tickets used by *[Tickets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Respawn#Respawn_Templates)* respawn template.

When player dies, number of tickets is decreased by 1. The most local tickets are always used. Example: When you first add tickets to player's side, they will be affected. If you later define tickets also to player's group, they will completely replace the side tickets.

When player runs out of the tickets, his respawn is disabled. If you use also *EndMission* respawn template, the mission will automatically end once tickets in all name spaces are exhausted.

syntaxArray.Return:
**target**: Receiver of the respawn tickets
[Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - use [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) to set/get global tickets available for everyone
[Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - remaining tickets in all name spaces

examples:
Add 5 tickets for BLUFOR

```sqf
[west, 5] call BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```
Return number of global tickets

```sqf
globalTickets = [missionNamespace] call BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```
Return number of player's tickets

```sqf
playerTickets = [player,nil,true] call BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```

```
 directory.
See [Arma 3 assets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3:_Assets).

The file is saved into *Screenshots* folder in the [Profile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Profile) directory. The folder is by default limited to 250 MB to prevent abuse.

To increase the limit, add the following line at the end of the profile file:

```sqf
maxScreenShotFolderSizeMB = 2000;
```

2000 can be replaced by any value in MB.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
syntaxArray.Params:
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) duration in seconds for which an objects remains on the screen before its screen is captured

type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "all") can be one of:

* "vehicles" - only characters and vehicles will be used

* "props" - only props will be used

* "all" - all objects will be used

sides: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Sides](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - (Optional, default all sides) list of sides. Only objects of these sides will be used

mods: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all mods) list of CfgMods classes. Only objects belonging to these mods will be used

addons: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all addons) list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used

classes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all classes) list of CfgVehicles classes. Only these objects will be used

bis_fnc_carrier01edeninit.name: BIS_fnc_carrier01EdenInit
bis_fnc_carrier01edeninit.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to assemble dynamic aircrfat carrier in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial init setup on EDEN editor invoked.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's possition is updated in EDEN editor.

*/
>

bis_fnc_hudlimits.name: BIS_fnc_HUDLimits
bis_fnc_hudlimits.description:
Set helicopter advanced flight model HUD limits and prevents overwriting existing values. See also [setHUDMovementLevels](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHUDMovementLevels).

Notes:

* default value is 0, which means no limits were assigned

* using 0 in min or max value will hide the corresponding limit

* same or higher priority will replace currently set priority

* using a negative priority will reset the values if absolute value is same or higher than current level

syntaxArray.Params:
speedLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

altLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

dirLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max, target]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - you can set a "negative" value by adding 360 (e.g using 270 instead of -90)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* target: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) the direction relative target

examples:
```sqf
[[0,0,0], [1, 0, 50], [0,0,0]] call BIS_fnc_HUDLimits; // limits altitude on HUD to 50m max
```

```sqf
[[0,0,0], [0, 0, 0], [1,330,30, myTarget]] call BIS_fnc_HUDLimits; // limits orientation towards myTarget by ±30°
```

bis_fnc_ondiarychanged.name: BIS_fnc_onDiaryChanged
bis_fnc_ondiarychanged.description:
/*

	Description:
	Register code to be executed when diary item changes.

	Arguments passed into code are:
		0: DISPLAY - map display
		1: BOOL - true if clicked on subject list, false when on record list (clicking on subject may also trigger record)
		2: STRING - subject name
		3: STRING - record name
		4: ANY - passed arguments (index of onDiaryChanged code when no custom arguments were used)

	Parameter(s):
	_this:
		CODE
		ARRAY - code with custom arguments in format [CODE,ARG1,ARG2,...]
		NUMBER - remove code of given index

	Returns:
	NUMBER - index of onDiaryChanged code
*/
>

bis_fnc_limitammunition.name: BIS_fnc_limitAmmunition
bis_fnc_limitammunition.description:
Limits the number of magazines carried by individual unit. Each container (uniform, vest and backpack) can be limited separately or left untouched.
	The function limits the number of magazines of each unique ammo category in respective container. Items like First Aid Kit or Mine Detector are not affected by the functionSet the minimum and maximum values in an array, for example [0.5,1] will set the magazine count anywhere between 50-100% of default count.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

uniformMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in uniform. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

vestMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in vest. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

backpackMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in backpack. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

bis_fnc_endmission.name: BIS_fnc_endMission
bis_fnc_endmission.description:
Ends mission with a fade effect. See [Debriefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Debriefing) for more information.
>

syntaxArray.Params:
**endName** (Optional, default "end1"):

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - end type, as used in [endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endMission) command

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [endName, ID], will be composed to "endName_ID" string

**isVictory**: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) true to successful end, false for failed end

**fadeType**: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default true) true for signature [closing shot](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Debriefing). When number, simple fade to black of given duration is used.

**playMusic**: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) false to disable automatic music during [closing shot](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Debriefing).

**completeTasks** (Optional, default false): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to cancel all pending tasks.

bis_fnc_parsenumbersafe.name: BIS_fnc_parseNumberSafe
bis_fnc_parsenumbersafe.description: Converts expression into a number. Can also convert array of expressions into an array of numbers. If expression does not return a number, 0 is returned.

syntaxArray.Params: input: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side), [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) -  If type is array, array may contain any of the mentioned data types
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) if [array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) is passed as an argument

examples:
```sqf
[safeZoneX,safeZoneWAbs,configFile] call BIS_fnc_parseNumberSafe; // Returns [-0.452381,1.90476,0]
```

```sqf
["1337","2013",date] call BIS_fnc_parseNumberSafe; // Returns [1337,2013,[2036,1,1,6,58]]
```

```sqf
[west,east,independent,civilian] call BIS_fnc_parseNumberSafe; // Returns [1,0,2,3]
```

bis_fnc_areequal.name: BIS_fnc_areEqual
bis_fnc_areequal.description:
This function returns true if all of the passed data elements are of the same type and value. One or more elements can be passed.

> 
**NOTES:**


* This function is an improvement over the == operator, because it can handle any data type in any combination.

* For arrays, it returns true if both arrays hold the same elements in the same order.

* If both values are undefined / nil / null, then this function will return true.

* **WARNING:** EXTREMELY large strings (> 4k) or compiled code (from a file, for example) might not be properly compared if they are only different near the end of the file.

syntaxArray.Params: anythings: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - any type of value: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side), [Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Text)

examples:
```sqf
[0, "0"]		call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // false
[0, 1 + 1 - 2]	call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // true
[str 50, "50"]	call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // true
```

bin_fnc_getgridcollisions.name: BIN_fnc_getGridCollisions
bin_fnc_getgridcollisions.description:
#define BUSH_WIDTH		2
#define BUSH_HEIGHT		2
#define TREE_TRUNK_WIDTH	0.5
#define TREE_TRUNK_HEIGHT	4

#define GET_POS\
	private _pos = _x modelToWorld (boundingcenter _x vectormultiply -1);

#define GET_BBOX\
	private _bbox = boundingboxreal _x;\
	private _bboxX = abs ((_bbox select 0 select 0) - (_bbox select 1 select 0)) / 2 + _cellSizeXHalf*0;\
	private _bboxY = abs ((_bbox select 0 select 1) - (_bbox select 1 select 1)) / 2 + _cellSizeYHalf*0;\
	private _bboxZ = abs ((_bbox select 0 select 2) - (_bbox select 1 select 2)) / 2 + _cellSizeZHalf*0;

	//_bboxZ = (abs (_bbox select 0 select 2) + abs (_bbox select 1 select 2)) + _cellSizeZHalf*0;

#define GET_BBOX_FIXED(SIZE)\
	private _bboxX = SIZE + _cellSizeXHalf;\
	private _bboxY = SIZE + _cellSizeYHalf;\
	private _bboxZ = SIZE + _cellSizeZHalf;

> 
 >

bin_fnc_addsiteentities.name: BIN_fnc_addSiteEntities
bin_fnc_addsiteentities.description:
/*

	Description:
		Register entities to a site, so they can be despawned with the rest when player leaves the area.

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - site logic. The site must be spawned for the function to work.
		1: ARRAY - entities to be added. Types can be mixed, the system will sort them out itself.

	Returns:
		BOOL - true if added
*/

#define ADD(ID)\
	(_entities select ID) pushback _x;\
	(_entityIDs select ID) pushback -1;

> 
 >

bis_fnc_getfrompairs.name: BIS_fnc_getFromPairs
bis_fnc_getfrompairs.description: Searches the associative array for the 1st occurance of the key string and returns the value associated with it. Search is not case sensitiv.

syntaxArray.Params:

key: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Key to search for

defaultValue: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - (Optional, default [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)) Default return value if no match was found

examples:
```sqf
[[["apple",3],["pear","test"]],"pear"] call BIS_fnc_getFromPairs; // Returns "test"
```

```sqf
[[["apple",3],["pear",6]],"pear"] call BIS_fnc_getFromPairs; // Returns "6"
```

bis_fnc_unitplaysimple.name: BIS_fnc_unitPlaySimple
bis_fnc_unitplaysimple.description: Plays back input movement data on input unit. Simplified.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [unit, data, varDone, stateIngnore, debug, sleep, skipTime] spawn BIS_fnc_unitPlaySimple
syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to play movement data on

data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Movement data to use

varDone: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Variable to set on specified Object once playback has finished in format:

* 0: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - Target

* 1: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name

stateIgnore: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) Whether to ignore if the Unit is dead and/or cannot move

debug: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) Whether to give debug information on played frames per second

sleep: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Time to Sleep between frames. This is if you want to be recording another unit and playing back movement data on another as well. Limit is 0-1 seconds.

skipTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Amount of time to skip at the start of playback. For example if you wish to play the data from halfway instead of the start.

bis_fnc_music.name: BIS_fnc_music
bis_fnc_music.description: Randomly play provided tracks defined in [CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgMusic) and does a 3 seconds [fade out](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/fadeMusic). This function takes [accTime](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/accTime) into account. See also [BIS_fnc_jukebox](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_jukebox).

syntaxArray.Params:
tracklist: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all game musics) a list of [CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgMusic) classes

delay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 3) delay in seconds between tracks

examples:
```sqf
[["myMusic1", "myMusic2"], 1] call BIS_fnc_music;
```

```sqf
[] call BIS_fnc_music; // will play all game tracks
```

bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.name: BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler
bis_fnc_addstackedeventhandler.description:
Stacks an event handler.  All event handlers accept user arguments, which are passed to the EH code in _this variable. If the EH has own params returned in _this variable as well, user arguments are appended to the end of _this array. Note that if you try to add empty EH, i.e. with empty code, it will simply be ignored.

Supported event handlers


* "[onEachFrame](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onEachFrame)" - no EH params

* "[onPlayerConnected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onPlayerConnected)" - EH params are passed as array in _this ([<id>,<uid>,<name>,<jip>,<owner>]) and in special variables _id, _uid, _name, _jip, _owner

* "[onPlayerDisconnected](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onPlayerDisconnected)" - EH params are passed as array in _this ([<id>,<uid>,<name>,<jip>,<owner>]) and in special variables _id, _uid, _name, _jip, _owner

* "[onMapSingleClick](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onMapSingleClick)" - EH params are passed as array in _this ([<units>,<pos>,<alt>,<shift>]) and in special variables _units, _pos, _alt, _shift

* "[onPreloadStarted](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onPreloadStarted)" - no EH params

* "[onPreloadFinished](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/onPreloadFinished)" - no EH params

>

syntaxArray.Params:
id: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - custom id, a unique identifier. Adding same type of EH with the same id will overwrite existing

event: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - event handler name, see description for supported EHs

code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String). The [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) is treated as function name

arguments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - arguments to make available in code in _this array
syntaxArray.Return: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - custom id on success or "" on failure

 *	name:		create sound entities	
 *	description:	creates sound entities(logic objects) and attaches to 
 *			an objects passed as parameter     
 *			After scene end it will detach and delete all created 
 *			sound entities (if scene was executed from scenes
 *			controller.
 *			 	
 *	paramater:	objects - ARRAY of OBJECTS in format without "BIS_" 
 *			prefix. For example, if you have BIS_Cooper in mission 
 *			than parameter will be [Cooper]. Then you can use 
 *			created sound entities as BIS_ZvukCooper say "something"    
 *						 	
 *	return value:	nothing 	
 * 
>

bis_fnc_scenecreatescenetrigger.name: BIS_fnc_sceneCreateSceneTrigger
bis_fnc_scenecreatescenetrigger.description: Create trigger for scene which can interrupt scene with name passed during creating the trigger. Scene name is saved in format **BIS_SceneIntDetector%1** where %1 is sceneName.

syntaxArray.Params:
sceneName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name of scene to associate with

bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.name: BIS_fnc_carrier01EdenDelete
bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to delete dynamic aircrfat carrier in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will delete carrier parts in EDEN editor after main object is deleted.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's parts are deleted in EDEN editor.

*/
>

bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.name: BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate
bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.description:
/*
	Author: Riccardo Argiolas

	Description:
    	Translates and scales (with pivot) and fades a picture over time.

	Parameters:
	Select 0 - CONTROL: picture that has to be modified
	Select 1 - NUMBER: how much the picture has to be scaled (>1 makes it bigger, 1 keeps it the same, <1 makes it smaller)
	Select 2 - STRING: select the pivot's position (i.e. center of the scaling process)
	Select 3 - ARRAY: how much the picture has to be translated/moved in [X,Y] format
	Select 4 - NUMBER: either the duration of the animation(default) or the speed of the translation, depending on what the next parameter is set to.
	Select 5 - BOOL: true = duration will be used, false = speed will be used.
	Select 6 - NUMBER: transparency of the image at the end of the animation (1 = invisible)

	Returns: 
	NUMBER: Duration of the animation. (Useful for determining how much sleep time is needed between animations)

	Examples:
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topLeft"] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	_t = [_controlFront, 1, "bottomRight", [0.1, 0.1], 0.5, false] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	sleep (_t * 2);
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topRight", [0.5, 0.3]] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
*/>

bis_fnc_getpitchbank.name: BIS_fnc_getPitchBank
bis_fnc_getpitchbank.description:
Returns the pitch and bank of an object, in degrees. **Yaw** can be found using the [getDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getDir) command.
**Pitch** is 0 when the object is level; 90 when pointing straight up; and -90 when pointing straight down.
**Bank** is 0 when level; 90 when the object is rolled to the right, -90 when rolled to the left, and 180 when rolled upside down.

>

syntaxArray.Params: object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
